text: I am trying to install the local hubl server, but i get an error saying the Java version is to low. Does anyone know how to fix this?
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
I actually downloaded the most recent version today :confused: It still doesn’t work
Did you install the developers kit?
Yes :slightly_smiling_face:
I’ll look into this internally. I recently installed the development kit from here: <http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk8-downloads-2133151.html>

my java version seems a lot different than yours ```java version "1.8.0_152"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-b16)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.152-b16, mixed mode)```java version "1.8.0_152"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_152-b16)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.152-b16, mixed mode)```
I’d attempt to install the “Java SE Development Kit 8u161” in the meantime, I’ll try to find out why a newer version isn’t compatible
That did the trick :smile: Thanks!
It may not understand Java 9 yet. Try installing java 8.

Does anyone else have issues with PageSpeed data on HS sites? I have a site getting a 16/100 on desktop and alot of it looks to be with:
- Leverage Browser Caching (almost nothing has expiry headers on it)
- Enable Compression 
- Minify Javascript (the cta JS script is whats being shown)
can you post the site url?
<http://www.thorek.org/>
<https://developers.google.com/speed/pagespeed/insights/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thorek.org%2F&tab=desktop>
:thumbsup:
Thanks. The big one is the image compression which you could do before you upload but we’re actively working on optimizing these for you.
Yea image compression is always a problem with clients choosing to upload insanely large images even when directed otherwise
obviously we have no control over includes from other sites like <http://rawgit.com|rawgit.com> and google
PageSpeed Insights v4 of their API is pretty buggy in my experience
always getting weird results
<@U2H3TT8F2> just make sure to use the new image_resize function and this will no longer be an issue :wink: - <http://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#resize-image-url>
thats a good point, i can make some changes to exisiting modules and update it for that.

We have CTAs that are coded with HTML tags in them, and I’m having an issue editing them because the CTA iframe preview is overlapping the rest of the editor below it. I have to set the iframe to display:none so that I can access the source code to make changes. I would love to see a max-height or something that would help keep the preview contained so that it doesn’t overlap the rest of the editor.
so what are people's leading solution for multi step forms since theres's no native way to do that in HubSpot?
we have clients asking about it often and i don't have a solid thought on it
and i don't really love any of these approaches <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/forms/how-do-i-create-a-multi-step-form>
there isn't a great solution.
making your own custom solution then copying the field values into a hidden HubSpot form would be easiest imo
^ :thumbsup_all:
Multi Part Mayhem!!!

in the past I used the richtext field in a form as a divider of sorts, then used javascript to look for that richtext field, slice and wrap each section in it's own div and went from there. But i wouldn't recommend doing that since the form markup could change at any point.
At Developer day in the fall wasn't there talk from the PM on Forms about introducing multistep forms? Did that get dropped?

I came across this the other day. Not sure if it would still work, but I'm guessing it would?
<http://school.insideinbound.com/courses/HubSpot-multi-page-form-course>

Is it possible to re-create the "instant blog notification" subscription with using workflows? or even possible for people to be subscribed to more than one subscription? Like a Daily and Monthly subscription.
for example having something like "Tech weekly subscription" and "Design Weekly Subscription"
then the user can subscribe to both
We have a workflow that takes custom checkbox options and then sets the "blog notifications" to push to others. Or a simple form submission for email to do what we want it to via workflow
<@U25C65C3S> for your first one, are you saying that you have a form that takes a multi-checkbox contact property and then judging on the choices sends email out based on the notifications?
nope, the multi checkbox workflow updates the individual Subscription settings based on the blogs
For instance, if a leadflow subscription happens this is our workflow
<@U25C65C3S> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25C65C3S/F9814V2F2/screen_shot_2018-02-13_at_5.25.36_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-02-13 at 5.25.36 PM.png>
so can a user be subscribed to more than one subscription though?
if you have different blog subscriptions then yes
I think you can setup an rss email for any list though no?
Is there a way to allow people subscribe to a specific TOPIC from 1 blog? :exploding_head:
I know on the subscribe form when you add the frequency it shows all subscriptions as radio buttons
<@U26C29XPH> thats what I am trying to achieve, i think it would have to be done only by creating a subscription level for each topic then doing as <@U25C65C3S> suggested with workflows.
Yeah, just seems like something HubSpot should have made easier to accomplish haha
agreed lol
so looks like this was asked back in 06: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Blog-subscription-by-topic/idc-p/3125/highlight/true#M198>
only thing is there is no "instant" option but daily should do it
Hello Shay. Is there a possibility that something is funky with the thank you message? We are having issues with special characters (nordic ÄÖÅ) in thank you messages
